page.title: 15Ashford Farm 2,Ashford C.
page.content: Charolais bull which was in a tube like a straw.This was kept in a container full of liquid nitrogen which kept the semen frozen.Mr Tudge had to use gloves when he took the tube out.It would take about 9 months before the calf would be born.The cows were milked for a second time later in the afternoon.Some of the milk that could not be used for bottling or sent to Cadbury's was used to feed the calves.We helped to give the calves their milk out of buckets.Mr Tudge has a bottling machine that he uses to bottle enough milk for his small milk delivery round.The bottles have a green top to show that it is unpasturised milk.Ashford Farm is a dairy farm but Mr Tudge grows some crops like hay,silage and wheat to feed to his dairy herd.
